description: Through the Spotify Web API your applications can retrieve and manage Spotify content.

args.name: client_id
args.info: The Client ID obtained from Spotify.

args.name: client_key
args.info: The Client Secret obtained from Spotify.

args.name: code
args.info: An authorization code that can be exchanged for an access token.

args.name: redirect_uri
args.info: The value of redirect_uri here must exactly match one of the values you entered when you registered your application, including upper/lowercase, terminating slashes, etc

args.name: client_id
args.info: The Client ID obtained from Spotify.

args.name: client_key
args.info: The Client Secret obtained from Spotify.

args.name: refresh_token
args.info: The refresh token returned from the getAccessToken method.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: id
args.info: The Spotify ID for the track

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: locale
args.info: Optional: The desired language, consisting of a lowercase ISO 639 language code and an uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore.

args.name: country
args.info: Optional: A country: an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want the list of returned items to be relevant to a particular country.

args.name: timestamp
args.info: Optional: A timestamp in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss. Use this parameter to specify the user's local time to get results tailored for that specific date and time in the day.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: country
args.info: Optional: A country: an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want the list of returned items to be relevant to a particular country.

args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: public
args.info: Optional: If true the playlist will be included in user's public playlists, if false it will remain private.

args.name: time_range
args.info: Optional: Over what time frame the affinities are computed. Valid values: long_term (calculated from several years of data and including all new data as it becomes available), medium_term (approximately last 6 months), short_term (approximately last 4 weeks). Default: medium_term.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: time_range
args.info: Optional: Over what time frame the affinities are computed. Valid values: long_term (calculated from several years of data and including all new data as it becomes available), medium_term (approximately last 6 months), short_term (approximately last 4 weeks). Default: medium_term.

args.name: access_token
args.info: A valid access token from the getAccessToken method

args.name: seed_artists
args.info: A comma separated list of Spotify IDs for seed artists.

args.name: seed_genres
args.info: A comma separated list of any genres in the set of available genre seeds.

args.name: seed_tracks
args.info: A comma separated list of Spotify IDs for a seed track.

args.name: market
args.info: Optional: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

args.name: limit
args.info: Optional: The target size of the list of recommended tracks. For seeds with unusually small pools or when highly restrictive filtering is applied, it may be impossible to generate the requested number of recommended tracks. Debugging information for such cases is available in the response. Default: 20. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 100.

args.name: acousticness_min
args.info: Optional: A confidence measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of whether the track is acoustic. 1.0 represents high confidence the track is acoustic.

args.name: acousticness_max
args.info: Optional: A confidence measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of whether the track is acoustic. 1.0 represents high confidence the track is acoustic.

args.name: acousticness_target
args.info: Optional: A confidence measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of whether the track is acoustic. 1.0 represents high confidence the track is acoustic.

args.name: danceability_min
args.info: Optional: Danceability describes how suitable a track is for dancing based on a combination of musical elements including tempo, rhythm stability, beat strength, and overall regularity. A value of 0.0 is least danceable and 1.0 is most danceable.

args.name: danceability_max
args.info: Optional: Danceability describes how suitable a track is for dancing based on a combination of musical elements including tempo, rhythm stability, beat strength, and overall regularity. A value of 0.0 is least danceable and 1.0 is most danceable.

args.name: danceability_target
args.info: Optional: Danceability describes how suitable a track is for dancing based on a combination of musical elements including tempo, rhythm stability, beat strength, and overall regularity. A value of 0.0 is least danceable and 1.0 is most danceable.

args.name: duration_ms_min
args.info: Optional: The duration of the track in milliseconds.

args.name: duration_ms_max
args.info: Optional: The duration of the track in milliseconds.

args.name: duration_ms_target
args.info: Optional: The duration of the track in milliseconds.

args.name: energy_min
args.info: Optional: Energy is a measure from 0.0 to 1.0 and represents a perceptual measure of intensity and activity. Typically, energetic tracks feel fast, loud, and noisy.

args.name: energy_max
args.info: Optional: Energy is a measure from 0.0 to 1.0 and represents a perceptual measure of intensity and activity. Typically, energetic tracks feel fast, loud, and noisy.

args.name: energy_target
args.info: Optional: Energy is a measure from 0.0 to 1.0 and represents a perceptual measure of intensity and activity. Typically, energetic tracks feel fast, loud, and noisy.

args.name: instrumentalness_min
args.info: Optional: Predicts whether a track contains no vocals. 'Ooh' and 'aah' sounds are treated as instrumental in this context. Rap or spoken word tracks are clearly 'vocal'. The closer the instrumentalness value is to 1.0, the greater likelihood the track contains no vocal content. Values above 0.5 are intended to represent instrumental tracks, but confidence is higher as the value approaches 1.0.

args.name: instrumentalness_max
args.info: Optional: Predicts whether a track contains no vocals. 'Ooh' and 'aah' sounds are treated as instrumental in this context. Rap or spoken word tracks are clearly 'vocal'. The closer the instrumentalness value is to 1.0, the greater likelihood the track contains no vocal content. Values above 0.5 are intended to represent instrumental tracks, but confidence is higher as the value approaches 1.0.

args.name: instrumentalness_target
args.info: Optional: Predicts whether a track contains no vocals. 'Ooh' and 'aah' sounds are treated as instrumental in this context. Rap or spoken word tracks are clearly 'vocal'. The closer the instrumentalness value is to 1.0, the greater likelihood the track contains no vocal content. Values above 0.5 are intended to represent instrumental tracks, but confidence is higher as the value approaches 1.0.

args.name: key_min
args.info: Optional: The key the track is in. Integers map to pitches using standard Pitch Class notation.

args.name: key_max
args.info: Optional: The key the track is in. Integers map to pitches using standard Pitch Class notation.

args.name: key_target
args.info: Optional: The key the track is in. Integers map to pitches using standard Pitch Class notation.

args.name: liveness_min
args.info: Optional: Detects the presence of an audience in the recording. Higher liveness values represent an increased probability that the track was performed live. A value above 0.8 provides strong likelihood that the track is live.

args.name: liveness_max
args.info: Optional: Detects the presence of an audience in the recording. Higher liveness values represent an increased probability that the track was performed live. A value above 0.8 provides strong likelihood that the track is live.

args.name: liveness_target
args.info: Optional: Detects the presence of an audience in the recording. Higher liveness values represent an increased probability that the track was performed live. A value above 0.8 provides strong likelihood that the track is live.

args.name: loudness_min
args.info: Optional: The overall loudness of a track in decibels (dB). Loudness values are averaged across the entire track and are useful for comparing relative loudness of tracks. Loudness is the quality of a sound that is the primary psychological correlate of physical strength (amplitude). Values typical range between -60 and 0 db.

args.name: loudness_max
args.info: Optional: The overall loudness of a track in decibels (dB). Loudness values are averaged across the entire track and are useful for comparing relative loudness of tracks. Loudness is the quality of a sound that is the primary psychological correlate of physical strength (amplitude). Values typical range between -60 and 0 db.

args.name: loudness_target
args.info: Optional: The overall loudness of a track in decibels (dB). Loudness values are averaged across the entire track and are useful for comparing relative loudness of tracks. Loudness is the quality of a sound that is the primary psychological correlate of physical strength (amplitude). Values typical range between -60 and 0 db.

args.name: mode_min
args.info: Optional: Mode indicates the modality (major or minor) of a track, the type of scale from which its melodic content is derived. Major is represented by 1 and minor is 0.

args.name: mode_max
args.info: Optional: Mode indicates the modality (major or minor) of a track, the type of scale from which its melodic content is derived. Major is represented by 1 and minor is 0.

args.name: mode_target
args.info: Optional: Mode indicates the modality (major or minor) of a track, the type of scale from which its melodic content is derived. Major is represented by 1 and minor is 0.

args.name: popularity_min
args.info: Optional: The popularity of the track. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.

args.name: popularity_max
args.info: Optional: The popularity of the track. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.

args.name: popularity_target
args.info: Optional: The popularity of the track. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular.

args.name: speechiness_min
args.info: Optional: Speechiness detects the presence of spoken words in a track. The more exclusively speech-like the recording (e.g. talk show, audio book, poetry), the closer to 1.0 the attribute value.

args.name: speechiness_max
args.info: Optional: Speechiness detects the presence of spoken words in a track. The more exclusively speech-like the recording (e.g. talk show, audio book, poetry), the closer to 1.0 the attribute value.

args.name: speechiness_target
args.info: Optional: Speechiness detects the presence of spoken words in a track. The more exclusively speech-like the recording (e.g. talk show, audio book, poetry), the closer to 1.0 the attribute value.

args.name: tempo_min
args.info: Optional: The overall estimated tempo of a track in beats per minute (BPM).

args.name: tempo_max
args.info: Optional: The overall estimated tempo of a track in beats per minute (BPM).

args.name: tempo_target
args.info: Optional: The overall estimated tempo of a track in beats per minute (BPM).

args.name: time_signature_min
args.info: Optional: An estimated overall time signature of a track. The time signature (meter) is a notational convention to specify how many beats are in each bar (or measure).

args.name: time_signature_max
args.info: Optional: An estimated overall time signature of a track. The time signature (meter) is a notational convention to specify how many beats are in each bar (or measure).

args.name: time_signature_target
args.info: Optional: An estimated overall time signature of a track. The time signature (meter) is a notational convention to specify how many beats are in each bar (or measure).

args.name: valence_min
args.info: Optional: A measure from 0.0 to 1.0 describing the musical positiveness conveyed by a track.

args.name: valence_max
args.info: Optional: A measure from 0.0 to 1.0 describing the musical positiveness conveyed by a track.

args.name: valence_target
args.info: Optional: A measure from 0.0 to 1.0 describing the musical positiveness conveyed by a track.
